page.title: 05AMENITIES IN DENWICK VILLAGE
page.content: Denwick would seem to have very few amenities but this does not seem to concern the people who live there. { {Mrs.Dixon has lived in the village for {82 years.}She remembers a school but says there is no need for one now with an ageing population and improved transport.She and her neighbour,{ {Mrs.Spratt,}rely on the mobile shops,the grocer and baker who call twice a week,the butcher who calls on Saturday and the mobile library which calls once a fortnight.They have to go into {Alnwick }to collect their pensions,for other shopping or to visit the doctor.They find the{2 {hourly bus service}good but expensive at 34p single as they remember when it was 1d.Most villagers would like some form of street lighting and some regret that the W.I.moved into Alnwick.
